noun.description: A mouthpart in various invertebrates; specifically: †(a) a gnathochilarium of a millipede (obsolete); (b) each of a pair of lobes or flaps formed on either side of the mouth by projections of the lining of the buccal cavity in nematodes of the order Spirurida.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Alpheus Packard (1839–1905). From pseudo- + labium.
